root.TEXT:
Record date: 2076-03-20
OFFICE NOTE
Lydia Levine MR #813-25-60-5 March 20, 2076
Ms. Levine is a 50-year-old, perimenopausal woman with non- insulin dependent diabetes, hypercholesterolemia, and a history of tobacco use, who underwent a recent cardiac catheterization for a positive stress test. At catheterization she had a proximal 60% lesion in her RCA as well as a mid 60-70% RCA lesion, obtuse marginal lesion of 60%, and an LAD mid lesion of 60%. At the time it was decided to continue medical therapy on Ms. Levine. Since her cardiac catheterization approximately two weeks ago, she has had no recurrent symptoms of chest pain. She continues on her medicines including Lopid 500 mg b.i.d., atenolol, aspirin, and sublingual nitroglycerin as needed, as well as her oral hypoglycemic medicines.
Physical Examination: She is an obese, white female in no acute distress. Her vital signs are stable. Lungs are clear to auscultation. Cardiac exam reveals regular rate and rhythm, normal S1 and S2; no murmurs, rubs or gallops. She has no peripheral edema.
Electrocardiogram shows a normal sinus rhythm at a rate of 70, axis of about 46, and there are no acute ST-T changes noted.
Impression/Plan: We will continue Ms. Levine on her current cardiac regimen. She has three-vessel coronary artery disease, non-obstructive in nature. As long as she remains asymptomatic on her current medical regimen, we will continue to follow her. She will return for a follow-up visit in approximately three months.
Quinn Ivey, M.D.
DD: 03/20/76 DT: 03/22/76 DV: 03/20/76
/aponte ******** Not reviewed by Attending Physician ********
